sentences: Barbara Russano Hanning (born 1940) is an American musicologist who specializes in 16th- and 17th-century Italian music.
She has also written works on the music of 18th-century France and on musical iconography.
She chaired the Music Department of The City College intermittently for fifteen years.
From 1993â€“1997 she served as president of the Society for Seventeenth-Century Music.

She has also contributed numerous entries to The New Grove Dictionary of Music and Musicians (1980) and its second edition of 2000; including biographical articles on Giulio Belli, Giulio Caccini, Gabriello Chiabrera, Marco da Gagliano, Giovanni Battista Guarini, Ottavio Rinuccini, Alessandro Striggio, and Torquato Tasso; and entries on the operas Dafne by Rinuccini, Dafne by Gagliano, Euridice by Peri, and Il rapimento di Cefalo by Caccini.
"From Saint to Muse: Representations of Saint Cecilia in Florence."
